result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt L Bence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Probation in Case 15CM1765, Count 1.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

DNA surcharge is to be paid as a Condition of Probation in Case 15CM1765, Count 1.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Jayne Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kurt L Bence in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $379
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation on 15CM1765.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing on June 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kurt L Bence in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  

Court will join the matters for trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kurt L Bence in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  
File not called on the record.
